comments.body: Add a link to the ACI object model here? I found https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/aci/apic/sw/1-x/aci-fundamentals/b_ACI-Fundamentals/b_ACI-Fundamentals_chapter_010001.html - not sure if that is the right thing.

Well, I contemplated using some of the drawings, because they are really helpful, but didn't want to go to the trouble getting the rights to reuse them. But a link to the document could be useful. Fact is that I consider people planning to write such modules to know about this already. Anyone responsible for working with Cisco ACI is already trained and possibly even certified as this is not something small shops will be using.
I'll add some links, it doesn't hurt.
ah, I was thinking of an inline link, but the "see also" section works too

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +19,23 @@Introduction
============
Ansible already ships with a large collection of Cisco ACI modules, however the ACI object model is huge and covering all possible functionality would easily cover more than 1500 individual modules.

If you are in need of specific functionality, you have 2 options:

comments.body: Active voice here if possible - "Once you've built the URL and filter string, your module is . . ."
It's not the reader that is building the URL and filter string, it is the code that does.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +200,204 @@Getting the existing configuration
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Once the URL and filter string have been built, the module is ready to retrieve the existing configuration for the object:

* ``state: present`` retrieves the configuration to use as a comparison against what was entered in the task. All values that are different than the existing values will be updated.
